A depiction of the typical approach, employment terms and average placement duration of assignments at the Group’s staffing segment is laid out below: We believe our “cell division” expansion strategy, which focuses on securing new sales before committing to additional costs, is a key driver of organic growth for our specialized talent solutions segment. We hire additional sales personnel at an existing branch to focus on developing opportunities out of our existing offices as commercial activity increases over time as we identify clear expansion opportunities. A new, dedicated commercial manager is appointed and given an agreed period of time ----- in order to acquire new clients or a new customer segment in a prospective area. Once these new clients have been secured and adequate revenue has been generated, the commercial manager opens a new office to handle such clients and becomes an office manager hiring their own staff. This strategy has allowed us to continually strengthen our geographic breadth and depth without pursuing acquisitions and with minimal risk, thereby driving our organic growth. We also believe that our variable compensation model, which rewards recruiters, sales consultants and office managers at our branches for finding, matching and retaining job candidates, also drives our organic growth, particularly for our engineering and consulting segment.

Subsubsection Title: Geographic Presence of our Staffing Segments
Subsubsection Text: Our clients’ HR staffing needs are typically local, requiring HR staffing for such clients’ local business location(s). For most of our Powerhouses, having branches close to our clients and job candidates is important to being able to find and match job candidates. As a result, our Powerhouses typically have a number of existing branches spread throughout the applicable geographic regions and focus on building scale and density by opening new branches throughout these areas in order to be closer to job candidates and clients. For the year ended December 31, 2021, Belgium, the Netherlands, Germany and France represented approximately 23.4%, 50.2%, 15.1% and 11.3%, respectively, of our Pro Forma Management Adjusted EBITDA. Information about the number of branches that we operate in each of our two segment staffing levels, as well as certain information about the branches operated by our principal Powerhouses, is provided below.

Subsection Title: Twelve months ended Key Performance Indicators –** **Nine months ended** **September Engineering and Consulting Segment** **Year ended December 31,** **September 30,** **30, 2019** **2020** **2021** **2021** **2022** **2022 (€ in millions, except percentages)
As of** **As of December 31,** **September 30, Key Performance Indicators – Engineering and Consulting Segment** **2019** **2020** **2021** **2021** **2022
Subsubsection Text: Abylsen is an engineering and consulting Powerhouse headquartered in France, with operations in France, Belgium, Switzerland, Italy and Luxembourg. Abylsen operates in a competitive but fragmented market, where it is a relatively small company which challenges primarily large global consulting or mid-sized global companies or brands, as well as regional companies or brands. _End-markets served and contract framework_ We provide engineering and technology consulting services to clients, with the majority of sales revenue from clients being from blue-chip or larger medium-sized companies. We also have a strong focus on SME clients. In terms of end-market, Abylsen is a multi-specialist Powerhouse providing engineering graduates to a wide range of end-markets. The largest end-markets served by Abylsen’s engineers are energy, industry, telecommunications and pharmaceutical, though we also served a number of clients in automotive, transport, aeronautics and defense and IT. Abylsen also serves these industries via its Boutiques Pharmacos, Pharma Insights, Belgatech, Mykelson, Greenworking and ETA. _Types of clients and job candidates_ Abylsen has a strong focus on balancing talent hiring and retention with wage control and turnover. Furthermore, it uses engineers to recruit and match engineering job candidates to clients and to provide in-house employees with end-market and job specialization and understanding. The service agreements Abylsen enters into with clients will vary from client to client depending on their end-market and staffing needs. For example, Abylsen also provided one of our clients, a leading pharmaceuticals company, with a team to monitor the remediation of emergency lighting defects across their expansive facilities. _Financial performance and other operating metrics_ Since its acquisition in March 2015, Abylsen’s EBITDA has grown from €17.7 million for the year ended December 31, 2015 to €20.4 million for the year ended December 31, 2021, with an EBITDA growth of 2.4% per annum, and its revenue has grown from €75.7 million for the year ended December 31, 2015 to €124.5 million for the year ended December 31, 2021, with a revenue growth of 8.6% per annum. As of September 30, 2022, Abylsen had 45 branches, 480 in house full time equivalent employees and 2,151 qualified specialists at work with different expertise (including mechanical, electrical and chemical engineering). For the twelve months ended September 30, 2022, Abylsen had _Pro Forma Management Adjusted Revenue of €206.2 million. The substantial majority of Abylsen’s_ revenue is generated in France, with the remainder of sales primarily being generated in Belgium. Bench time was at 2.8% for the twelve months ended September 30, 2022.

Subsection Title: As of** **As of December 31,** **September 30, Key Performance Indicators – Engineering and Consulting Segment** **2019** **2020** **2021** **2021** **2022
Subsubsection Text: Redmore is a provider of specialized secondment and consulting services in our engineering and consulting segment headquartered in the Netherlands, with operations in the Netherlands, Poland and a ----- newly opened international branch in Spain (Triple A – Risk Finance) and Portugal (ITDS). We typically provide consulting and secondment services to clients through job candidates with university degrees or applied university degrees who are predominantly but not exclusively on indefinite term contracts with us. Redmore and its Boutiques operate primarily in the banking and insurance sectors, and also for governments and companies seeking financial staffing in enterprise recourse planning (“ERP”) implementation, with competitors of a variety of sizes, including large global companies and the “Big Four” accountancy firms. Redmore has five complementary brands: Talent&Pro, Triple A - Risk Finance, Profource, ITDS and Vialegis: - **_Talent&Pro focuses on secondment of its own job candidates for the Dutch financial end- market who are either on indefinite term contracts with us, temporary personnel or freelancers (whom we have screened and assessed); - **_Triple A - Risk Finance_** provides consulting services in the area of actuary and risk management services and job candidates placed by Triple A - Risk Finance ordinarily have actuarial and risk managements backgrounds; - **_Profource provides secondment and consulting services through our job candidates who are specialized in optimizing finance processes, the execution of enterprise resource planningrelated assignments and business processes outsourcing; - **_ITDS provides specialist consulting for insurance companies, pension funds and banks; and - **_Vialegis provides legal staffing solutions, including search and selection services, with a focus on highly skilled white-collar job candidates primarily to the largest law firms in Belgium, Luxembourg and Germany. Vialegis also offers, mainly in Belgium, interim legal counsels to large corporates, for interim legal services and projects. Vialegis was one of our Powerhouses in the engineering and consulting segment, but was sold to Redmore on September 30, 2021 and has since been operating as part of Redmore and is no longer a separate platform. _End-markets served and contract framework_ While the majority of Redmore’s revenue comes from large corporates, SMEs and intermediate sized enterprises also contribute a significant portion of its overall revenue. In terms end-market, Redmore is a specialist Powerhouse providing financial consulting services to end-markets including insurance, banking, government and health, as well as to other corporates. Redmore, through its five Boutiques, is primarily engaged on time and material contracts. For the year ended December 31, 2021, 92.5% by revenue of the contracts for the Boutiques under Redmore were time and material contracts. Based on our periodic assessment of our contracts, we estimate that a typical service agreement between these brands and a client will be a time and materials contract for an average duration of six to ten months. Furthermore, our job candidates in Redmore are typically employees on our payroll with an indefinite contract, meaning that bench time may occur. As a result, this is a metric which is carefully monitored. Redmore also monitors the chargeability of its job candidates since a number of its job candidates, primarily in its consulting services, will be engaged periodically on non-chargeable activities such as training or pre-sale activities, which are expected to benefit the Powerhouse’s sales in the long-run, but will result in periods where job candidates are not generating revenue for the Powerhouse. Redmore’s revenue also stems from various other sources, including fees relating to business process outsourcing for certain banks and insurance companies performed via its service center in Utrecht, search and selection fees generated by Vialegis and Ctrl-F for permanent placement at clients and fees relating to freelance placement. _Types of clients and job candidates_ ----- Redmore has a strong focus on training, coaching and evaluating its job candidates and placing them in assignments that develop their skills through experience. We typically recruit young professionals and provide training to them from day one and over their years of employment with us as job candidates to develop their financial expertise. The Powerhouse also offers an in-house academy with certifications and qualifications, knowledge and competency frameworks to attract and retain job candidates and to develop them with increasing market value for its clients. For many of the assignments for which our Powerhouses’ job candidates are eligible, their market value (the bill value we can charge), increases more quickly than the salary requirements (the payment we make to job candidates), which contributes to the bill-pay spread and our Group’s profitability. The service agreements that each of the brands under Redmore enters into with clients will vary from client to client depending on a number of factors including their end-market and staffing needs. Examples of service agreements entered into by each of Redmore’s brands are provided below: - Talent&Pro provided a team of job candidates, comprising of a mix of junior and senior job candidates, to one of our clients, a Dutch bank, to fulfil their need for compliance professionals for a Customer Due Diligence Enhancement project involving approximately 30,000 KnowYour-Customer files related to SMEs. Talent&Pro designed and ran this project through an outsourcing solution, including management, quality control and reporting. Talent&Pro placed 52 consultants through 2020 and 2021. This agreement generated a total revenue of €3.1 million, of which €2.8 million was generated in 2021. - Profource was asked by one of its clients, a global e-commerce company, to implement and rollout a new HR application, the Oracle HCM Cloud Time & Labor and Absence Management, in 21 countries. Profource provided a team of eleven consultants and project managers to successfully deliver this project, which generated a total revenue of approximately €0.4 million in 2021. - ITDS was asked by one of its clients, a term life insurance company, to assist with the selection and implementation of a new core administrative system. In 2021, we placed four consultants on this project, and this service agreement is expected to run until the end of 2023 and generate a total revenue of approximately €2.0 million, of which we invoiced €0.2 million in 2021 and €0.6 million in the nine months ended September 30, 2022. - Triple A - Risk Finance was selected by several insurance companies to help implement IFRS 17. At four major Dutch insurance companies, Triple A - Risk Finance placed 31 job candidates at each company in 2021. These projects together generated a total revenue of €4.6 million. - Vialegis, at the request of one of its longstanding clients, an independent Belgian law firm, searched and successfully recruited a team of lawyers consisting of three partners and seven associates to join the client from another independent law firm. This placement generated a one-off fee of €0.1 million. _Financial performance and other operating metrics_ Since its acquisition in December 2017, Redmore’s EBITDA has grown from €20.4 million for the year ended December 31, 2017 to €36.1 million for the year ended December 31, 2021, with an EBITDA growth of 15.3% per annum, and its revenue has grown from €108.1 million for the year ended December 31, 2017 to €138.0 million for the year ended December 31, 2021, with a revenue growth of 6.6% per annum. As of September 30, 2022, Redmore had 20 offices, with 246 in-house full-time equivalent employees and 2,040 job candidates at work. For the twelve months ended September 30, 2022, Redmore had revenues of €211.3 million. Nearly all of Redmore’s revenue is generated in the Netherlands. Bench time was at 1.1% during the same period. -----

Subsection Title: As of** **As of December 31,** **September 30, Key Performance Indicators – Engineering and Consulting Segment** **2019** **2020** **2021** **2021** **2022
Subsubsection Text: Continu Professionals is a specialist in finding white-collar secondment solutions for the engineering and construction markets in our engineering and consulting segment. It is headquartered in the Netherlands, with branches throughout the Netherlands, two branches in Belgium and a branch in Germany that was opened at the beginning of 2019. Continu Professionals provides secondment solutions to clients through job candidates who are planners, foremen, superintendents, technical designers, project managers, architects and a wide variety of engineers such as in manufacturing, infrastructure and construction (including specialization in social housing corporations) research and development, and mechanical. _End-markets served and contract framework_ The substantial majority of sales revenue from clients comes from SME and intermediate sized enterprises. In terms of end-markets, Continu Professionals was a mono-specialist Powerhouse providing secondment services towards the construction end-market, but has been diversifying its services to include the industrial, civil and mechanical engineering end-markets. It has also increased its specialization within the construction end-market through its acquisition of mténv, which is focused on social housing corporations, as well as with the acquisitions of TechMatch in January 2020 and Solyne in January 2021, both generally on technical profiles, with Solyne focusing primarily on public infrastructure projects. Continu Professionals is primarily engaged on time and material contracts, with a focus on assignments that provide opportunities for temporary placements to lead to permanent positions, or “temp-to-perm.” Continu Professionals’ exposure to bench time is limited due to its use of back-to-back contracts (meaning a contract is entered into between us and the job candidate in connection with a secondment or other staffing assignment with a client for the same duration) and short notice periods towards seconded job candidates. Furthermore, since 2016, Continu Professionals has been a member of the Algemene Bond Uitzendondernemeningen (the “ABU”), which means the applicable CLA is the ABU CLA. This allows Continu Professionals to enter into multiple consecutive temporary contracts within five years with an employee (as opposed to three under provisions applicable to it before joining the ABU) and has also allowed Continu Professionals to offer longer duration contracts. See “Regulation” for further information. For the year ended December 31, 2021, all of the contracts for the Boutiques under Continu Professionals were time and material contracts, with a typical service agreement between Continu Professionals and a client being for an average duration of twelve months. Continu Professionals also engages in executive search assignments, including providing assessment services, for some of its existing customer. _Types of clients and job candidates_ Continu Professionals provides nationwide coverage through the Netherlands, offering a high degree of specialization through its job candidates. The Powerhouse is recognized among the Group for its best practices with respect to job candidate retention, providing regular touch points with job candidates throughout their candidate journey, starting from first contact through to satisfaction surveys while on assignment, as well as scheduled touch points to recognize and celebrate key events such as signing a contract and the job candidate’s birthday. The service agreements Continu Professionals enters into with clients will vary from client to client depending on their end-market and their staffing needs. For instance, Continu Professionals placed 78 job candidates at the world’s leading lithography company which generated approximately €2.5 million in revenue in 2021. Continu Professionals also placed 42 job candidates in engineering and construction roles as well as a sales manager on premises at one of our clients, a European construction services business, in 2021. This engagement brought in approximately €2.2 million in revenue in 2021. ----- _Financial performance and other operating metrics_ Since its acquisition in September 2015, Continu’s EBITDA has grown from €11.0 million for the year ended December 31, 2017 to €11.8 million for the year ended December 31, 2021, with an EBITDA growth of 1.3% per annum, and its revenue has grown from €68.7 million for the year ended December 31, 2015 to €97.7 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 (which includes the combined revenue contribution from the bolt-on acquisitions of MT&V in June 2018, Hartd in December 2018, and TechMatch in January 2020 of €38.0 million), with a revenue growth of 6.0% per annum. Continu’s revenue growth was affected in 2020 and 2021 due to management issues and adverse regulatory conditions, as well as due to the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic. As of September 30, 2022, Continu Professionals had 19 branches, with 240 in-house full-time equivalents and 1,845 job candidates at work. For the twelve months ended September 30, 2022, Continu Professionals had revenues of €134.4 million. Nearly all of the Continu Professionals’ sales revenue is generated in the Netherlands. Due to the open ended contracts and short notice periods possible with Continu Professionals’ job candidates, bench time is not a primary key performance indicator for this Powerhouse.

Subsection Title: As of** **As of December 31,** **September 30, Key Performance Indicators – Engineering and Consulting Segment** **2019** **2020** **2021** **2021** **2022
Subsubsection Text: Cohedron is a Dutch full-service staffing provider specializing in the government and public sector with a goal to make a meaningful impact. With more than 3,000 qualified specialists and over 30 years of experience, Cohedron supports and advises public authorities and non-profit organizations through its offering of outsourcing of processes and secondment of qualified specialists, as well as consultancy to organizations and public authorities in areas such as debt counselling, budget management and administration to drive efficiencies and costs savings. _End-markets served and contract framework_ The substantial majority of sales revenue from clients comes from governments and local authorities. Cohedron focuses on assignments that serve municipalities, government and public sector companies. Cohedron’s scope of services provided through its Boutiques include secondment services, spatial communication, content management, job classification, compensation and benefits, interim HR services, reorganization, social medical care consulting, social media administration, municipal guardianship, debt counselling, budget management obligations, capacity issues and consulting on government regulations. _Types of clients and job candidates_ Cohedron’s Boutiques include Argonaut, Future Communication, Human Capital Group, Plangroep, Plangroep Financiële Services, Sqiq, Wyzer, Zorg-Lokaal, Vanberkel Professionals and Bureau Brug. Through these Boutiques, Cohedron provides support and advices clients in the government and public sector to better serve their constituents by offering three services, namely outsourcing, secondment and consultancy. All business lines in Cohedron have a well-educated workforce with experience in the sectors they work for. Most of Cohedron’s contracts are awarded through public tenders. The majority of the revenues of Cohedron comes from municipalities, while other participants in the government and public sector, such as police, universities, railway, tax authorities and ministries, and clients in the private sector such as banking institutions, insurers and energy suppliers, also generate steady revenues. Job candidates are generally placed on outsourced long-term contracts, secondment framework agreements or consultancy with service contracts. _Financial performance and other operating metrics_ As of September 30, 2022, Cohedron had 15 branches with 323 internal full-time equivalent employees and 1,858 full-time equivalent professionals working at the client. For the twelve months ended ----- September 30, 2022, Cohedron had Pro Forma Management Adjusted Revenue of €207.3 million. All of the Cohedron’s sales revenue is generated in the Netherlands. The productivity rate was 86.8% for the twelve months ended September 30, 2022.

Subsection Title: As of** **As of December 31,** **September 30, Key Performance Indicators – Engineering and Consulting Segment** **2019** **2020** **2021** **2021** **2022
Subsubsection Text: SOLCOM is a German specialist in contracting services covers primarily lucrative, highly specialized IT and engineering segments across various industries within the DACH region. SOLCOM mostly works with experienced freelancers only. SOLCOM facilitates and manages the process of matching clients with experienced freelancers throughout the contracting period. _End-markets served and contract framework_ The substantial majority of sales revenue from clients comes from Germany. SOLCOM’s invoice service is primarily offered on a time and material basis, either via hourly or daily rates based on preagreed terms with client. SOLCOM is primarily engaged in client and freelancer contracts, with a focus on projects in the specialized IT and engineering sector. Each client contract is designed individually to ensure flexibility and compliance with all relevant regulations, while we also use standardized contracts with certain experts. _Types of clients and job candidates_ SOLCOM’s client base is comprised of several blue-chip as well as mid-sized companies primarily in the automotive and transport, aviation and aerospace, consumer, energy chemical and financial services industries, who regularly seek support to fill positions with highly specialized expert support. Client representatives are often from technical departments which requires matching of profiles to be efficient and hassle-free. The diversification of industries is the foundation of SOLCOM’s stable and predictable revenues generation. SOLCOM has a network of over 100,000 experts who are highly experienced and educated, and a majority of these experts possess an academic background in technical fields, such as computer sciences, engineering, mechanical engineering and civil engineering. _Financial performance and other operating metrics_ As of September 30, 2022, SOLCOM had 286 in-house full-time equivalent employees and 1,786 freelancers at work. For the twelve months ended September 30, 2022, SOLCOM had _Pro Forma Management Adjusted Revenue of €217.6 million. Nearly all of SOLCOM’s sales revenue is generated in Germany.

Subsection Title: As of** **As of December 31,** **September 30, Key Performance Indicators – Engineering and Consulting Segment** **2019** **2020** **2021** **2021** **2022
Subsubsection Title: Other Powerhouses and Boutiques of the Engineering and Consulting Segment
Subsubsection Text: Our engineering and consulting segment also includes GRITT (which includes TEC and Logi-technic and operates in Belgium and Luxembourg), as well as IBB and AERO, which are engineering and consulting Boutiques of TIMEPARTNER (a Powerhouse in the specialized talent solutions segment). Sales from the GRITT contributed 7.1% of the engineering and consulting segment’s revenue for the twelve months ended September 30, 2022, and AERO and IBB together contributed 3.8% of the engineering and consulting segment’s revenue for the twelve months ended September 30, 2022.

Subsection Title: Twelve months ended Key Performance Indicators – Specialized** **Nine months ended** **Septembe Talent Solutions Segment** **Year ended December 31,** **September 30,** **r 30, 2019** **2020** **2021** **2021** **2022** **2022 (€ in millions, except percentages)
As of** **As of December 31,** **September 30, Key Performance Indicators – Specialized Talent Solutions Segment** **2019** **2020** **2021** **2021** **2022
Subsubsection Text: Accent is a specialized staffing Powerhouse focused exclusively on the Belgian specialty market, with operations in Belgium and offices in Poland, Romania, Moldova and Portugal for the sourcing of job candidates from its international recruiting network. Accent operates in a competitive and consolidated market where it challenges larger global staffing solutions companies or brands, as well as regional companies or brands. _End-markets served and contract framework_ Accent focuses on the more sustainable and profitable “temp-to-perm” contracts, with a focus on different niches and with a strong network of local branches, specialized to serving a specific type of job candidate profile and client end-markets. Nearly all of the sales revenue from this Powerhouse comes from SMEs or intermediate sized enterprises who value speed and flexibility, a close customerrelationship and who are willing to pay a premium for Accent’s services, therefore quality over quantity. In terms of end-markets, Accent provides primarily blue-collar job candidates, of whom approximately 25% are foreign workers, to a wide range of end-markets. The largest end-markets served by Accent’s job candidates are the construction, transportation, food service and hospitality end-markets, though our job candidates also serve a number of clients in the services, healthcare and transport markets. Accent is mostly engaged on time and material contracts, with a focus on “temp-to-perm” assignments. Pursuant to temporary worker legislation in Belgium, Accent is typically able to align its job candidates’ contract durations with its clients’ contract duration, resulting in no exposure to bench time. See “Regulation.” For the year ended December 31, 2021, nearly all of Accent’s contracts were time and material contracts, with an average duration of 40 days. Since 2018, Accent has also begun to offer search and selection services via its Ctrl-F Boutique, which are invoiced on a fee basis and are primarily ----- supported by an internal “digital talent hunter” recruitment team. Accent’s revenues also include those generated by NOWJOBS and Gighouse in Belgium. _Types of clients and job candidates_ Accent has a strong focus on developing best services for a fast-yet-high-quality candidate and client matching, driven by strong digital initiatives for which Accent is being recognized as a pioneer in the market. Since assignments are typically for a relatively short duration, being able to quickly match a job candidate and client quickly is important. Accent combines strong intimacy in the front with a strong efficiency in the back. Accent assisted one of our clients, a sanitaryware wholesaler with its on-going demand to find temporary job candidates and then hire them as permanent employees by co-creating a website for applicants and helped to coordinate the required education for future sanitary technicians. Accent also assigned a dedicated single point of contact to a large infrastructure company to assist, through one of its Boutiques, Engie, in the recruitment of the more technical profiles. _Financial performance and other operating metrics_ As of September 30, 2022, Accent had 384 branches, which branches reflect teams dedicated to specific specialty job candidates, 1,166 full-time equivalent employees and 28,987 job candidates at work. For the twelve months ended September 30, 2022, Accent had Pro Forma Management Adjusted Revenue of €618.8 million. Nearly all of the Powerhouse’s sales revenue is generated in Belgium.

Subsection Title: As of** **As of December 31,** **September 30, Key Performance Indicators – Specialized Talent Solutions Segment** **2019** **2020** **2021** **2021** **2022
Subsubsection Text: Covebo is a blue-collar specialized staffing Powerhouse. It is focused on the Dutch specialty blue-collar staffing market, with operations in the Netherlands, as well as its branches in Hungary, Lithuania, Spain, Poland and Romania, which are part of its international recruiting network. _End-markets served and contract framework_ Covebo focuses on temporary staffing for two primary end-markets: (1) construction and technical, including technical, construction and infrastructure jobs; and (2) production and logistics, including food, logistics and industry jobs. Nearly all of the sales revenue from this Powerhouse comes from SMEs or intermediate sized enterprises, with certain exceptions relating to larger clients in the production and logistics end-market. Covebo provides blue-collar job candidates to its clients, of which typically approximately 80% are foreign workers. The most frequent end-markets served by Covebo’s job candidates are the food production, retail, logistics, engineering and construction and infrastructure end-markets. Through its digital initiative Fygi, Covebo offers interim recruitment, search and selection and recruitment marketing services. Independent freelancers will become recruiters for mostly white-collar profiles at different companies, by using Covebo’s digital tools and platforms. Covebo takes a commission on the revenue generated by these freelancers. Revenue of this initiative for the year ended December 31, 2021 was €5.4 million. Nearly all of Covebo’s contracts are typically flexible contracts, meaning that Covebo is not obligated to pay any temporary job candidate not engaged in billable work for up to the first 52 weeks (depending on the employment agreement entered into with such job candidate), with discretionary temporary employment agreements permitted to be entered into (with up to a maximum of six employment agreements) over the next three years (depending on the employment agreement entered into with such job candidate) thereafter. Covebo’s exposure to bench time is thus limited due to the regulatory framework and their ability to use of flexible contracts with job candidates. Some job candidates placed by Covebo are freelancers, especially in the VNOM offices of Covebo. For the year ended December 31, 2021, the substantial majority of Covebo’s service agreements with clients were time and material ----- contracts, with an average of 5.8 job candidates per client, with an average duration of approximately 41 weeks. Covebo New Energy was launched at Covebo. Covebo New Energy is specialized in mediating technicians in the sustainable industry, such as solar panel technicians, insulation technicians, electric charging station technicians, air and heat pump technicians, windmill technicians and technicians who specialize in other new energy sources. _Types of clients and job candidates_ Covebo was one of the first dedicated blue-collar foreign recruiting based staffing companies in the Netherlands. It offers a full-service foreign recruiting process for job candidates and clients by facilitating and organizing housing, transportation and insurance (including health insurance) and offering social guidance and support. In 2018, Covebo launched an in-house education program, the Covebo Craftsman School, to support its full-service proposition which offers foreign job candidates education on Dutch tools, materials and ways of working. The program trains and tests candidates on various skills such as masonry, plumbing, electrics and painting. It also facilitates quick onboarding since job candidates have been assessed as part of the training program and familiarized with customerspecific standards. _Financial performance and other operating metrics_ Since its acquisition in June 2015, and including the contributions of Accent NL, Covebo’s EBITDA has grown from €5.6 million for the year ended December 31, 2015 to €17.9 million for the year ended December 31, 2021, with an EBITDA growth of 21.4% per annum, and its revenue has grown from €117.4 million for the year ended December 31, 2015 to €311.6 million for the year ended December 31, 2021, with a revenue growth of 17.7% per annum. As of September 30, 2022, Covebo had 8,095 beds for job candidates, 1,365 cars for people at work and 7,788 health insurance policies for its foreign temporary job candidates. As of September 30, 2022, Covebo had 40 branches, 831 full-time equivalent employees, 12 international recruiting offices and over 12,156 job candidates at work. For the twelve months ended September 30, 2022, Covebo had revenue of €540.7 million. Nearly all of the Powerhouse’s sales revenue is generated in the Netherlands.

Subsection Title: As of** **As of December 31,** **September 30, Key Performance Indicators – Specialized Talent Solutions Segment** **2019** **2020** **2021** **2021** **2022
Subsubsection Text: TIMEPARTNER specializes in the staffing of high-demand blue-collar profiles in Germany and offers tailor-made and integrated flexible HR-solutions in the field of temporary staffing, personnel placement, provision of temporary workers and on-site management. In June 2021, we acquired avanti, which complements TIMEPARTNER’s service portfolio by adding a presence in the medical and healthcare segment. Following the acquisition of LP Personalvermittlung, avanti will operate under our new Powerhouse, House of Care Talents Germany. In addition, Zaquensis, previously a Powerhouse in our legacy general staffing segment, is now part of the TIMEPARTNER operation following the partial merger between TIMEPARTNER and Zaquensis in the second quarter of 2021. TIMEPARTNER also has operations in the Czech Republic. _End-markets served and contract framework_ TIMEPARTNER typically provides low- to medium-skilled job candidates who are from general backgrounds to clients from a diversified group of end-markets, with the greatest concentration of clients typically being from the industry, logistics, construction, aviation, food and automotive endmarkets. The job candidate placements by TIMEPARTNER (except IBB and AERO) are typically short- to medium-term (with a maximum duration of 18 months), unless agreed otherwise by company unions (approximately 48 months). In general, the contract framework for temp employees are indefinite duration, making it a core task for TIMEPARTNER to perfectly match the job assignments with the contract duration. That means it is crucial to make sure the (very short) notice period of client agreements corresponds to the assignment duration and matches the notice periods of the employees, ----- or otherwise to staff temp employees on new assignments. TIMEPARTNER also provide specialized services through avanti in relation to the provision of medical and care personnel to hospitals, special clinics, rehabilitation clinics and nursing homes. _Types of clients and job candidates_ TIMEPARTNER’s clients particularly value the ability to place job candidates quickly (particularly for short-term staffing needs), quality candidate pools, assistance and peace of mind regarding our ability to help them comply with and navigate complicated regulatory and compliance landscapes, and good value for money. Additionally, customers are using our competence as a master vendor to manage all their temporary workforce, or, to a less extent, as a recruiting partner. TIMEPARTNER’s job candidates are often looking for an HR staffing company that can find them a job quickly, treat them well, provide opportunities for clients to take them on as permanent employees and have a good pool of local job opportunities. TIMEPARTNER facilitates these interests from clients and job candidates by having good industry knowledge in the markets that we serve, making decisions quickly, having a quality pool of candidates available (and working with our international recruiting network, where needed, to ensure we can help staff shortages) and job candidates for management positions with good experience and skills. _Financial performance and other operating metrics_ Since its acquisition in 2016 (based on the combined performance of Zaquensis and TIMEPARTNER following their merger in 2021 and including the contributions from the bolt-on acquisitions of Mach in 2017 and Weiderer in 2018), TIMEPARTNER’s EBITDA has grown from €28.6 million for the year ended December 31, 2016 to €33.3 million for the year ended December 31, 2021, with an EBITDA growth of 3.1% per annum, while its revenue has decreased from €425.6 million for the year ended December 31, 2016 to €420.4 million for the year ended December 31, 2021 due to the impact of the AüG regulatory reform and the dynamics in the aerospace segment. As of September 30, 2022, TIMEPARTNER had 190 branches, 555 full-time equivalent employees and 10,264 job candidates at work. For the twelve months ended September 30, 2022, TIMEPARTNER had Pro Forma Management Adjusted Revenue of €356.6 million. Nearly all of the Powerhouse’s sales revenue is generated in Germany. **TMI** On March 3, 2022, we acquired TMI, our new Powerhouse in our specialized talent solutions segment. TMI specializes in providing staffing service for the healthcare sector in the Netherlands, assisting with the recruitment of candidates for healthcare providers such as hospitals, public care institutions, ambulance staff and nursing homes. TMI also supplies temporary staff, intermediates for freelancers, and offers flexible jobs. Their job candidates usually include doctors, nursing staff, psychologists, and pharmacists. _End-markets served and contract framework_ TMI provides services primarily to clients in the healthcare sector, such as hospitals, public care institutions, ambulance staff and nursing homes. Services rendered include providing temporary staff (flex, 0-hours and secondment) in times of peaks or sickness, as well as general recruitment. Placements in this segment are typically short- to medium-term, unless agreed otherwise by the client. Most clients have a framework contract with TMI for a period of one to three years with yearly indexation or collective employment raise. _Types of clients and job candidates_ TMI provides services to a broad array of healthcare clients, who particularly value the high quality candidates, broad pool of professionals and the “one stop shopping” service model offered by TMI. ----- TMI is well recognized as the leading healthcare staffing company in the Netherlands that helps clients to ensure continuity of healthcare services despite an ever-increasing shortage of qualified personnel in the industry. TMI’s job candidates are often looking for a staffing company that provides a broad selection of clients and placement opportunities without the restrain of irregular rosters, and offers good financial benefits and the opportunity for further education (such as through the TMI Academy). _Financial performance and other operating metrics_ As of September 30, 2022, TMI had 16 branches, 123 full-time equivalent employees and 3,114 job candidates at work. We estimate TMI contributed €56.0 million to Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA for the twelve months ended September 30, 2022. See “Summary consolidated other financial and Pro _Forma information—Pro Forma Adjusted Historical Information of the Company.”_
